lead_paragraph: Barcelona finally met its match on the streets of its home city as up to a million fans flocked to welcome the team home from its European Champions League triumph. Barcelona, which won the Spanish League, the King’s Cup and the Champions League, struggled to get through the crowds. Having beaten Manchester United, 2-0, in Rome on Wednesday, Coach Pep Guardiola and captain Carles Puyol carried the European Cup down the steps from the plane on Thursday. The team boarded an open-top bus with the trophies propped up inside the front windshield for a journey that took more than three hours.
